I nearly got run over by the delivery van I was driving. It overheated and me and my boss were fixing it. He thought it wasn't in gear and I always leave vehicles in gear.
So, I'm working in the engine bay and he goes and starts it. It's in gear, so it just goes. How I managed to roll out of the way, I'll never know. He had to chase it for 20 meters and managed to switch it off, just before it hit the wall.

WRITING.TITLE: How to force VLC to open on the same screen as I closed it on?
WRITING.TEXT: I want VLC to open on the monitor I closed it on - I'm using dual screens. Is this possible?

What it doesn't show is one of the more interesting parts - the analogue/mechanical computer. This:
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/f2/84/53/f284537fb94f85b3bd4de31efca5b2ef.jpg
Is what lives down in the very bottom pan of many automatic gearboxes. It uses oil pressure and solenoids to shift the gears at the correct time. Another, showing the pistons which actuate things:
https://i.stack.imgur.com/BH6Q0.jpg
